## {{< fa box-open title="an open box" >}} Anticipated deliverable(s) {#anticipated-deliverables}

By the end of today's workshop, you should have:

- A working draft of your cover letter. 
- An updated resume that incorporates new content or revisions from Fall quarter. 

## {{< fa book-open title="an open book" >}} Learning objectives {#learning-objectives}

By the end of today's workshop, you should be able to: 

- Format and design cover letters using Bren best practices. 
- Tailor cover letters to specific job postings, with each section clearly marketing their skills and experiences for the role. 
- Explain the role of a strong cover letter within the overall job search process.

## {{< fa plus title="plus" >}} What should I continue working on? {#continue-working}

- [**Continue refining and polishing your resume and cover letter.**]{.teal-text} Aim to have both documents about 80% complete before you begin applying for jobs. This will allow you to focus the remaining 20% on tailoring your materials to each position and submit applications efficiently (ideally within 2–4 days of a job posting opening).
